resources.string: This app is here to help with all your meditation needs from tips and tools to integrate meditation into your daily life, to learning how to use the natural elements in balancing.
You can find many more features in the menu bar including tracking your progress and daily inspirational quotes to keep you going.
Most importantly, get ready for a journey in discovering a whole new way to approach meditation and to finding peace of mind through the key principles of thoughtlessness and balance.

Welcome to the beginning of a new experience in meditation. You will soon discover the impact that meditation can have in your daily life and how you can develop your understanding of relaxation in a new light.
Make sure you listen to the introductory recording before your first meditation and check out our glossary for detailed explanations of the vocabulary used.
Enjoy short, guided meditations by selecting the mood which best describes how you feel.
These meditations are an easy way to learn to cope with negative emotions.
Remember to compare how you feel before and after the meditation!
Here you will learn how to bring your energy centres and channels into balance using simple techniques.
The elements are here to help
The elements play a role in bringing us back into balance and can be used in our daily meditations.
Please begin by listening to the introductory recording which explains this section and familiarise yourself with the terms and actions.
Track your meditation progress and rate your daily meditations on this page.

The criteria for rating your meditations are 
	1) How thoughtless did you feel during the mediation? 
	2) How peaceful do you feel now? 
	3) How balanced do you feel compared to when you began?
The music provided here will help create the atmosphere for a nice meditation. You may prefer to meditate in silence.

The term life energy refers to an energy that exists in all living beings. It is what supports the growth, healing and nurture of our physical, emotional and spiritual self. During meditation we connect with this nurturing energy which regenerates us and brings us into balance.

This life energy acts within the subtle system. The subtle system is parallel to the nervous system but is not physically manifested. It consists of three energy channels (left, right and centre) and energy centres which are found on the nerve plexuses along our spinal cord. The channels and energy centres each play different roles in maintaining our physical, emotional and spiritual health. When we are in meditation, our life energy passes through these channels and centres and nourishes them.

Meditation is a state in which our mind is completely without thoughts and our body is relaxed. We call this state thoughtless awareness (see below). It is not about focusing or concentrating on something in particular but freeing your mind and allowing your body to regenerate.

The state in which we are aware of our surroundings but are engaging in our thoughts. It does not mean we are not able to think but rather that we can stop all thoughts that are not allowing us to be in the present moment.
Nerve plexuses are networks of nerves along the spinal cord. The location of the energy centres in our subtle system correspond to the location of these nerve plexuses.

Energy centres are located in our subtle system and are found along our spinal cord at the nerve plexuses. Each centre is associated with various functions and qualities, an excess or lack of which can negatively affect the centre. Most of the problems we face in our daily lives can be traced back to an imbalance or blockage in one or more of these centres. Through meditation one can remove these blockages and strengthen the centres to bring oneself into balance.

This channel is found on the left side of our subtle system. It is associated with our past and emotions. When this channel is not stable this can result in lethargy, extreme emotions and/or mood swings. To strengthen this channel, meditation using the fire and earth elements is beneficial.

This channel is found on the right side of our subtle system. It is associated with action and planning and an excess of these can result in anger, irritability and stress. When this channel is overworked it gets overheated and we can cool it down by meditation with the water and air elements.
Your true self refers to the essence of who you are. When we meditate we aim to reconnect with this essence which can be clouded by social and cultural conditionings.

Meditate to Regenerate is a non-profit organization that promotes meditation as a way to further lifelong learning for all. We offer the experience of mental silence meditation coupled with self-development workshops as well as music, dance and artistic performances. We have conducted meditation, music, and dance tours in the Turkey, Lebanon, Jordan, Egypt, Morocco, USA and throughout the UK and the EU. The meditation experience that we teach is, and always will be completely free of charge.\n\nmeditatetoregenerate.org
